com.github.restdriver.clientdriver

Class ClientDriver

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.restdriver.clientdriver.ClientDriver
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    SecureClientDriver

    public class ClientDriver
extends Object
    The main class which acts as a facade for the Client Driver.

    • Field Detail

      • jettyServer

        protected org.eclipse.jetty.server.Server jettyServer

      • handler

        protected ClientDriverJettyHandler handler

    • Constructor Detail

      • ClientDriver

        public ClientDriver(ClientDriverJettyHandler handler)
        Constructor. This will find a free port, bind to it and start the server up before it returns.
        Parameters:
        handler - The ClientDriverJettyHandler to use.

      • ClientDriver

        public ClientDriver(ClientDriverJettyHandler handler,
                    int port)
        Constructor. This will bind to the given port and start the server up before it returns.
        Parameters:
        handler - The ClientDriverJettyHandler to use.
        port - The port to listen on. Expect startup errors if this port is not free.

      • ClientDriver

        protected ClientDriver()
        Convenience constructor for extending classes. This allows overwriting and customization of the setup procedure.

    • Method Detail

      • getPort

        public int getPort()

      • getBaseUrl

        public String getBaseUrl()
        Get the base URL which the ClientDriver is running on.
        Returns:

        The base URL, which will be like "http://localhost:xxxx".

        There is no trailing slash on this

      • verify

        public void verify()
        Verifies that all expectations have been met and nothing unexpected has been requested. If the verification fails, a ClientDriverFailedExpectationException is thrown with plenty of detail, and your test will fail!

      • noFailFastOnUnexpectedRequest

        public void noFailFastOnUnexpectedRequest()
        Make the mock not fail fast on an unexpected request.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets the expectations and requests in the handler.

      • shutdownQuietly

        public void shutdownQuietly()
        Shutdown the server without verifying expectations.

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
        Shutdown the server and calls verify().

      • addExpectation

        public ClientDriverExpectation addExpectation(ClientDriverRequest request,
                                              ClientDriverResponse response)
        Add in an expected ClientDriverRequest/ClientDriverResponse pair.
        Parameters:
        request - The expected request
        response - The response to serve to that request
        Returns:
        The newly added expectation.
